head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Attempted-Larceny Charges

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Attempted-Larceny Charges

body.head.byline: By JENNIFER 8. LEE; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: Carmen Sierra and her brother, Juan Sierra, are charged with attempting to steal money collected during services at church in Brooklyn (S)

block.p: Officers arrested two people yesterday morning while investigating two previous thefts at a church in Kensington, the police said. Carmen Sierra, 42, and her brother Juan Sierra, 43, were charged with attempted grand larceny and disruption of a religious service. The police said the two tried to steal money collected during services at the Holy Innocents Church, at East 17th Street near Beverley Road, shortly before 11 a.m. Ms. Sierra tried to break into a room while her brother served as a lookout, the police said. An undisclosed amount was stolen from the church on March 25, and an attempted burglary occurred on March 18, the police said. Mr. and Ms. Sierra have not been charged in connection with the previous crimes, the police said.
